original: Åstrand, Erik August, civilingenjör, fd. förste baningenjör, Nässjö, f. 3/2/81 i Sund, Östergötl. I., av överste August A. o. Hedvig Arehn. G. 13 m. Elsa Nathorst-Wästfelt. Barn: Per-Erik f. 14, ing., Sthlm, Bertil 24, Folke 29. — Stud:ex. i Jönköp. 01, avg:ex. fr. KTH (V) 06. Bitr. ing. h. dåv. löjtn. Ingemar Petersson 06-07, anst. v. övre norra väg- o. vattenibyggn :distr. 07, h. Linköip. stad 07-10, e. tj :m:an v. SJ 10-11, und :ing. 11, byggn :förest. v. Nässjö bangårds omjbyggn. 16, baninsp. 17, tf. sekt :ing. v. dubbelspårsbyggn. Tranås-Sävsjö 17-21, tjf. förste baning. i Kiruna 21-23, förste baning. där 23-25, baning. i Alvesta 25-26, i Nässjö 26-36, förste baning. i Nässjö 36-46. Pens. 46. Tillf. anst. s. baning. i Nässjö, Ystad o. Kristianstad 46. Led. av Nässjö byggn :nd 17-21. RVO 33.
translated:
Åstrand, Erik August, civil engineer, former chief railway engineer, Nässjö, b. 3/2/81 in Sund, Östergötland. Son of Colonel August A. and Hedvig Arehn. Married for 13 years to Elsa Nathorst-Wästfelt. Children: Per-Erik, b. 1914, engineer, Stockholm; Bertil, b. 1924; Folke, b. 1929. 

Education: Passed student examination in Jönköping in 1901, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (V) in 1906. Assistant engineer under Lieutenant Ingemar Petersson from 1906-1907. Employed by the upper northern road and water construction district in 1907, worked for the Municipality of Linköping from 1907-1910. Employed by SJ (Swedish Railways) as a technical assistant in 1910-1911, became an engineer in 1911. Building supervisor for the reconstruction of Nässjö railway station in 1916, inspector of railway construction in 1917, acting section engineer for double-track construction between Tranås and Sävsjö from 1917-1921, acting chief railway engineer in Kiruna from 1921-1923, chief railway engineer there from 1923-1925, railway engineer in Alvesta from 1925-1926, in Nässjö from 1926-1936, and chief railway engineer in Nässjö from 1936-1946. Retired in 1946. Temporarily employed by the railway in Nässjö, Ystad, and Kristianstad in 1946. Member of the Nässjö building committee from 1917-1921. Received the Royal Order of Vasa in 1933.

organization.name: Upper Northern Road and Water Construction District
Double-track Construction between Tranås and Sävsjö
